intro: Dictyophragmus lactucoides, commonly known as the milkweed of the genus Dictyophragmus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, alternate leaves and showy, yellow flowers that typically bloom in clusters. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, wind-dispersed seeds. It is often found in arid or semi-arid regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its unique floral structure and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and ecologists.
